title: Nice Client
body: Hey man, Atleast nearly 3 or 4 years after the new client came out, it works about as good as the brains that came up with it tbh. Atleast you have Riot on Twitter saying that their opinion on champs is better than the population of the game playing those champs everyday. Talking down to players like youre game isnt made by the shits you take in the toilet daily. How hard is it to fix a client man, these bugs werent a thing on the old one just bring it back ffs.

replies.body: What have you tried so far and what (specifically) are the issues you are facing? Let's see if we can get this fixed for ya.

> [{quoted}](name=Ninox,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=7vXYZVBX,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2020-01-13T10:09:24.000+0000)
>
> What have you tried so far and what (specifically) are the issues you are facing? Let's see if we can get this fixed for ya.

The main issues are client lag. I'm not 100% sure what triggers it but sometimes my client will be so slow I will have to wait around 4 seconds for my commands to respond its not in game at all just on the client. 
It seems to start after someone dodges a queue or I leave the after game wrap up screen. Once it starts the only way to stop it is to close the client and reopen it.

Hmm that's an odd one. Depending on where your PC falls on the low/high-end spectrum some of these suggestions may be more impactful than others but let's give it a go. In Order: 

1. Enable low spec mode for your client. The new client is far better optimised than the old one, but it also added a lot of eye candy and animation type stuff since most people can support them.
2. As a safety option, I'd also recommend running a client repair.
3. Ensure your GPU drivers are up to date. Outdated drivers can cause all sorts of weird issues.
4. In Task Manager, hit 'More Details" (if it's not already open) and sus what kind of values the client is using (probs take a screenshot). Once it starts slowing down, have another look and see if it's spiked. If they haven't, it's likely there's something else taking priority or chewing up resources which is messing with the client.
5. Clean out your drives. This is especially true for HDDs but an overfull drive can cause slow-down in a lot of weird ways.
6. Run a clean reinstall. Download the [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support-leagueoflegends.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool), select clean re-install, and follow the prompts.

Failing all else, submit a ticket to player support and they should be able to help you further: https://support-leagueoflegends.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

They can analyse logs and the like so if none of these suggestions work they will be your best bet at finding a solution (just list everything you've already tried in the ticket).

Ok so all drivers up to date and a repair was done as soon as the problem came about.

I checked and it is already in low spec mode.

drives are very clean, I do not use the computer for much else. Is there a Cache file for the client i can delete or anything like that?

Running a clean install will be my Very last option as restarting the client makes it work again. I do think im not the only one with the problem as i have had others saying they cant change runepages when their client is bugged

As fare as caches and old files, a clean reinstall is by fair the easiest option to make sure you clean out everything. The rune-page bug is a known issue and is most likely unrelated to your issue (which sounds like it is local rather than global).

As far as i can tell, the rune page bug only happens for me when my client is lagging. it might be worth looking into.

I've noticed mine becomes sluggish with pauses, even when typing in the chat box after a little while. Reloading fixes it so dunno. It's a nice client compared to the old one, but it's just so...what's the word, bloated? Menu after menu and option after option.

Hmm, that's not an issue I've ever really heard of. Could be related to some sort of memory leak rather than the League client itself. Do you experience anything similar with any other programs?

What have you tried in the direction of fixing it?

First reccomendations are GPU driver update and a client repair, but some more specific symtoms, timeframe, and a list of hwat you've already tried would be real helpful.

If you could be more specific on what issues you are experiencing, we can probably provide some help and/or info. Preseason is always a little unstable both game and client-side because of all the new changes rolling through so rapidly, but pretty much all the major ones were resolved before the start of the new season.
